sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects instances of svchost.exe running with an unusual or uncommon command line parameter by excluding known legitimate or common patterns.
This could point at a file masquerading as svchost, a process injection, or hollowing of a legitimate svchost instance.

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=%WINDIR%\system32\svchost.exe; Image=C:\Windows\system32\svchost.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential WMI Lateral Movement WmiPrvSE Spawned PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Powershell as a child of the WmiPrvSE process. Which could be a sign of lateral movement via WMI.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Registry Tampering by Potentially Suspicious Processes
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects suspicious registry modifications made by suspicious processes such as script engine processes such as WScript, or CScript etc.
These processes are rarely used for legitimate registry modifications, and their activity may indicate an attempt to modify the registry
without using standard tools like regedit.exe or reg.exe, potentially for evasion and persistence.

match_context.values: @{EventType=SetValue; Details=QWORD (0x00000000-0x0063b014); Image=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKU\S-1-5-21-1070296143-2877979003-364783958-1001\Software\Microsoft\Windows Script\Settings\Telemetry\wscript.exe\JScriptSetScriptStateStarted}
@{EventID=13; EventType=SetValue; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe; Details=Binary Data; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Notifications\Data\418A073AA3BC1C75}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects potentially suspicious keywords that could indicate the use of a PowerShell exploitation framework
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Perez Diego (@darkquassar), Tuan Le (NCSGroup)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Binary Or Script Dropper Via PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell creating a binary executable or a script file.

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\ProgramData\pFffckm.js}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: RegAsm.EXE Execution Without CommandLine Flags or Files
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects the execution of "RegAsm.exe" without a commandline flag or file, which might indicate potential process injection activity.
Usually "RegAsm.exe" should point to a dedicated DLL file or call the help with the "/?" flag.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=56953994707668803A070FBEA09B56ECA9C397AC,MD5=6E964AEBBF00FE8E25BF28CE22734E44,SHA256=613B37387DAF3698DF4A8BAF6E4350473EBC3F23682D368221CD8DEA9DE2FB63,IMPHASH=F34D5F2D4577ED6D9CEEC516C1F5A744; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=RegAsm.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae .NET Framework; Description=Microsoft .NET Assembly Registration Utility; FileVersion=4.8.9032.0 built by: NET481REL1; ParentCommandLine=powershell "$ddsfdgdfhdjhsdfgdgo = ' [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\RegAsm.exe"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\RegAsm.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=MD5=0D5DF43AF2916F47D00C1573797C1A13,SHA256=C066AEE7AA3AA83F763EBC5541DAA266ED6C648FBFFCDE0D836A13B221BB2ADC,IMPHASH=F34D5F2D4577ED6D9CEEC516C1F5A744; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=RegAsm.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae .NET Framework; Description=Microsoft .NET Assembly Registration Utility; FileVersion=4.8.4084.0 built by: NET48REL1; ParentCommandLine=powershell "$ddsfdgdfhdjhsdfgdgo = ' [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\RegAsm.exe"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\RegAsm.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=MD5=0D5DF43AF2916F47D00C1573797C1A13,SHA256=C066AEE7AA3AA83F763EBC5541DAA266ED6C648FBFFCDE0D836A13B221BB2ADC,IMPHASH=F34D5F2D4577ED6D9CEEC516C1F5A744; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=RegAsm.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae .NET Framework; Description=Microsoft .NET Assembly Registration Utility; EventID=1; FileVersion=4.8.4084.0 built by: NET48REL1; CommandLine="C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\RegAsm.exe"; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\RegAsm.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}
@{CommandLine=%WINDIR%\microsoft.net\framework\v4.0.30319\regasm.exe; Image=C:\Windows\microsoft.net\framework\v4.0.30319\regasm.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\wbem\wmiprvse.exe; CommandLine=powershell "$ddsfdgdfhdjhsdfgdgo = ' [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wbem\WmiPrvSE.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Get the processes that are running on the local computer.

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.
